description: In this course, students build an audition book of repertoire, surveying eras and genre-specific
styles within the musical theater canon. Students develop an understanding of contemporary vocal
styles unique to each repertoire category and practice techniques for both in-person and
self-taped auditions according to industry standards. Coursework includes in-class and self-taped
performances, goal-setting, and career preparation. Offered annually in Spring semester.
